1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
2
3-- | Decode terms.
4
5module Koshucode.Baala.Data.Decode.Term
6  ( -- * Decode terms
7    -- ** Term name cache
8    CacheT, cacheT,
9
10    -- ** Term name
11    treeFlatName, treeFlatNameCached,
12    treesFlatNames,
13    treesFlatNamesCo,
14    treesFlatNamePairs,
15    treesNamesByColon,
16
17    -- ** Term
18    treesTerms, treesTermsCached,
19    treesTerms1,
20  ) where
21
22import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture              as O
23import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base                  as B
24import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax                as S
25import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Pattern        as P
26import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Data.Decode.Message   as Msg
27
28
29-- ============================================  Decode terms
30
31-- ---------------------------------  Term name cache
32
33-- | Term name cache.
34type CacheT = O.CacheS S.TermName
35
36-- | Empty term name cache.
37cacheT :: CacheT
38cacheT = O.cache [] S.toTermName
39
40-- ---------------------------------  Term name
41
42-- | Read flat term name from token tree.
43--   If the token tree contains nested term name, this function failed.
44--
45--   >>> S.toTree "/a" >>= treeFlatName
46--   Right (TermName EQ "a")
47--
48--   >>> S.toTree "+/a" >>= treeFlatName
49--   Right (TermName GT "a")
50--
51--   >>> S.toTree "/a/x" >>= treeFlatName
52--   Left ...
53--
54treeFlatName :: S.Tree -> B.Ab S.TermName
55treeFlatName = fmap snd . treeFlatNameCached cacheT
56
57-- | Cached version of 'treeFlatName'.
58treeFlatNameCached :: CacheT -> S.Tree -> B.Ab (CacheT, S.TermName)
59treeFlatNameCached cc (P.LTerm n) = Right $ O.cacheGet cc n
60treeFlatNameCached _  (P.L t)     = Msg.reqFlatName t
61treeFlatNameCached _  _           = Msg.reqTermName
62
63-- | Read flat term names.
64--
65--   >>> S.toTrees "/a +/b -/c" >>= treesFlatNames
66--   Right [TermName EQ "a",TermName GT "b",TermName LT "c"]
67--
68treesFlatNames :: [S.Tree] -> B.Ab [S.TermName]
69treesFlatNames = mapM treeFlatName
70
71-- | Decode term names with optional complement symbol.
72-- 
73--   >>> S.toTrees "~ /a /b" >>= treesFlatNamesCo
74--   Right (True, [TermName EQ "a",TermName EQ "b"])
75-- 
76--   >>> S.toTrees "/a /b" >>= treesFlatNamesCo
77--   Right (False, [TermName EQ "a",TermName EQ "b"])
78--
79treesFlatNamesCo :: [S.Tree] -> B.Ab (Bool, [S.TermName])
80treesFlatNamesCo trees =
81    do (co, trees2) <- treesTermCo trees
82       ns <- mapM treeFlatName trees2
83       Right (co, ns)
84
85-- | Term complement symbol.
86treesTermCo :: [S.Tree] -> B.Ab (Bool, [S.Tree])
87treesTermCo (P.LRaw "~" : trees)  = Right (True,  trees)
88treesTermCo trees                 = Right (False, trees)
89
90-- | Decode a list of name-and-name pairs.
91-- 
92--   >>> S.toTrees "/a /x /b /y" >>= treesFlatNamePairs
93--   Right [(TermName EQ "a", TermName EQ "x"), (TermName EQ "b", TermName EQ "y")]
94--
95treesFlatNamePairs :: [S.Tree] -> B.Ab [S.TermName2]
96treesFlatNamePairs = loop where
97    loop (a : b : xs) = do a'  <- treeFlatName a
98                           b'  <- treeFlatName b
99                           xs' <- loop xs
100                           Right $ (a', b') : xs'
101    loop [] = Right []
102    loop [_] = Msg.missPairTerm
103
104-- | Decode term names grouped by colons.
105--
106--   >>> S.toTrees "/a /b : /p /q : /x /y" >>= treesNamesByColon
107--   Right [ [TermName EQ "a", TermName EQ "b"]
108--         , [TermName EQ "p", TermName EQ "q"]
109--         , [TermName EQ "x", TermName EQ "y"] ]
110--
111treesNamesByColon :: [S.Tree] -> B.Ab [[S.TermName]]
112treesNamesByColon = loop [] [] where
113    loop ret ns (P.LTerm n  : ts)  = loop ret (S.toTermName n : ns) ts
114    loop ret ns (P.LRaw ":" : ts)  = loop (reverse ns : ret) [] ts
115    loop ret ns []                 = Right $ reverse $ reverse ns : ret
116    loop _ _ _                     = Msg.reqTermName
117
118-- ---------------------------------  Terms
119
120-- | Read list of named token trees from token trees.
121--
122--   >>> S.toTrees "/a 'A3 /b 10" >>= treesTerms
123--   Right [ (TermName EQ "a", [TreeL ...]),
124--           (TermName EQ "b", [TreeL ...]) ]
125--
126treesTerms :: [S.Tree] -> B.Ab [S.Term [S.Tree]]
127treesTerms = name where
128    name [] = Right []
129    name (x : xs) = do let (c, xs2) = cont xs
130                       n    <- treeFlatName x
131                       xs2' <- name xs2
132                       Right $ (n, c) : xs2'
133
134    cont :: [S.Tree] -> ([S.Tree], [S.Tree])
135    cont xs@(x : _) | isTermLeaf x  = ([], xs)
136    cont []                         = ([], [])
137    cont (x : xs)                   = B.consFst x $ cont xs
138
139-- | Test token tree is term leaf.
140isTermLeaf :: O.Test S.Tree
141isTermLeaf (P.LTerm _)   = True
142isTermLeaf _             = False
143
144-- | Cached version of 'treesTerms'.
145treesTermsCached :: CacheT -> [S.Tree] -> B.Ab (CacheT, [S.Term [S.Tree]])
146treesTermsCached = name where
147    name cc [] = Right (cc, [])
148    name cc (x : xs) =
149        do let (c, xs2) = cont xs
150           (cc1, n)    <- treeFlatNameCached cc x
151           (cc2, xs2') <- name cc1 xs2
152           Right (cc2, (n, c) : xs2')
153
154    cont :: [S.Tree] -> ([S.Tree], [S.Tree])
155    cont xs@(x : _) | isTermLeaf x  = ([], xs)
156    cont []                         = ([], [])
157    cont (x : xs)                   = B.consFst x $ cont xs
158
159-- | Read list of named token trees from token trees.
160--   This function wraps long branches into group.
161treesTerms1 :: [S.Tree] -> B.Ab [S.Term S.Tree]
162treesTerms1 xs = do xs' <- treesTerms xs
163                    Right (S.ttreeGroup O.<$$> xs')
164
